name: ClickupLegacyTimeTracking
description:
Log time entry for a ClickUp task using legacy endpoint.

This tool allows logging time entries for a specific ClickUp task using a legacy API endpoint. It should be called when you need to record time spent on tasks, although it's recommended to use the updated Time Tracking API for new implementations.

parameters.name: clickup_task_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task for which time is being logged. This can refer to either the standard task ID or a custom task ID if specified.

parameters.name: start_time_unix_epoch
parameters.description: The start time of the time entry in Unix epoch format. This is required to log time for a task.

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: Epoch timestamp indicating when the time tracking ended for the task.

parameters.name: time_spent_seconds
parameters.description: Duration of time spent on the task in seconds. This is the time you want to log for the specific task.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Provide the Workspace ID when `custom_task_ids` is `true`.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

parameters.name: use_custom_task_ids
parameters.description: Set to true to reference a task by its custom task ID.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: custom_task_ids
parameters.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

value_schema.description: If you want to reference a task by it's custom task id, this value must be `true`.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

value_schema.description:
When the `custom_task_ids` parameter is set to `true`, the Workspace ID must be provided using the `team_id` parameter.
 \
For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
